intro: Tovaria bodinieri, commonly known as the Bodinier's tovaria, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
